name: nod
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 to move your head down and then up, sometimes several times, especially to show agreement, approval, or greeting, or to show something by doing this: Many people in the audience nodded in agreement. When I suggested a walk, Elena nodded enthusiastically. She looked up and nodded for me to come in. Compare
shake verb (MOVE)
More examplesFewer examplesHe nodded his head in greeting.She nodded her assent to the proposal.He nodded his head sagely.She signified her agreement by nodding her head.She listened sympathetically, nodding her head now and again.

a movement up and down with the head: Chen gave her a nod of recognition across the crowded room.
a vote or nomination (= the act of officially suggesting that someone or something should be given a prize or position) for someone or something: Neeson received an Oscar nod for his role in Schindler's List. At the time, Clinton and Obama were locked in a battle for their party's nod.
